body_html:
The error persists after doing all the steps above

sudo pip2 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade --force-reinstall --user numpy
sudo pip2 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade --force-reinstall numpy
sudo rm -rf /home/[usrname]/.cache

On inspection of the error, it seems the folder /home/user/.cache/bazel/_bazel_user/1f82..... does not even exist and bazel clean did not solve this issue.

I deleted tensorflow folder to clone it again from scratch and this did it for me.
body_text:
The error persists after doing all the steps above
sudo pip2 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade --force-reinstall --user numpy
sudo pip2 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade --force-reinstall numpy
sudo rm -rf /home/[usrname]/.cache

On inspection of the error, it seems the folder /home/user/.cache/bazel/_bazel_user/1f82..... does not even exist and bazel clean did not solve this issue.
I deleted tensorflow folder to clone it again from scratch and this did it for me.
body:
The error persists after doing all the steps above
```
sudo pip2 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade --force-reinstall --user numpy
sudo pip2 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade --force-reinstall numpy
sudo rm -rf /home/[usrname]/.cache
```

On inspection of the error, it seems the folder `/home/user/.cache/bazel/_bazel_user/1f82.....` does not even exist and `bazel clean` did not solve this issue.

I deleted tensorflow folder to clone it again from scratch and this did it for me.
